page.title: 10Cropwell Bishop,Vicarage Pt1
page.content: In{1879}a vicarage was built on the present site of Dobbin Close.This was demolished in 1973.Prior to this vicarage an earlier vicarage had been sited in Stockwell Lane.The decision to build the new vicarage had been made by the{Rev.Charles Dobbin}who had been a vicar in Cropwell Bishop in the 19th Century.He died in 1900,and was vicar for 21 years.In all six vicars resided in the new vicarage they were- the {Rev. C. Dobbin - 21 years " {J. Wood - 1924 - 1937 " {J. Wood - 1947 son of above "{ Edwards - 1947 " {Starmer - 1952 - 1956 " {Blimming- up to 1970 The Old Vicarage. The old vicarage had a building to the side which had housed horses and coaches. {CONTINUED ON PAGE 18.
